The OP-1 Synth

A hardware digital audio workstation
üìÖ Feb 28th 2022 Transmission #31 Connection: Retroreflector

The OP-1 is a computer-keyboard sized synth with just enough capability to mostly replace a DAW.

I‚Äôm a programmer with quite a bit of piano playing experience. My idea with the purchase of the OP-1 was to be able to make my own sounds and music for whatever software I end up making.

I wanted to list everything that it can do, but I feel like it‚Äôs more effective if I just link to a Red Means Recording video where he uses the OP-1 to create a full song.

OP-1 05-26-16 (Nicotine) by Red Means Recording skip to 12:50 for the finished edited version of the song

It‚Äôs strengths are it‚Äôs looping, sampling, and especially it‚Äôs synth customization options.

You can import instruments and drum kits by recording with the mic or with the audio input jack.

It manages to be understandable with very few instructions through conventional symbols and an info button for when you can‚Äôt figure out what something does.

That‚Äôs about all I have to say, I‚Äôve been enjoying using it for making short songs and unique sounds.

Hope you found it as interesting as I did.
